headings: Bachelor of Social Work Field Education
B.S.W. Field Education Handbook and Polices
paragraphs: A key component of Angelo State University’s Bachelors of Social Work (B.S.W.) is the field education experience.

The purpose of field education is to provide opportunities for students to apply social work knowledge, skills, values, and cognitive and effective processes learned in the classroom to real-life situations with clients “in the field”. Students are supervised by a professional social worker or related degree individual in the field agency (the Field Instructor) and by field faculty (Field Education Liaison and Field Education Director) at the University.
The B.S.W. Field Director will assist students in locating their field placement.

Students who have been accepted into Field Education must provide evidence of professional liability insurance to the Field Education Director, at the 1 million/3 million level, coverage prior to beginning their field education experience.
Field Education students who do not purchase malpractice insurance will not be allowed to meet with any clients or complete their field education.

The Department of Social Work and Sociology began usingInPlacein Fall 2021. InPlace is an internship management platform. Students and Agency Field Instructors will use InPlace for applications, time sheets, weekly supervision logs, evaluations, and so forth.
Thank you for considering a partnership with the Angelo State University Social Work and Sociology Department.
Through agency experiences and supervision, students have the opportunity to learn and become socialized into the profession.

As a new field placement, you will need the following: an affiliate agreement between the agency and university. Field Instructors should have an B.S.W. degree from a CSWE-accredited program and 2 years post-graduation experience in social work to supervise the students; field instructor should be with the agency for a minimum of 6 months; space for the students as well as any applicable equipment; and ensure that the supervisor can meet with the students for 1 hour every week during their placement.
B.S.W. Field Students are required to complete 500 hours of Field Education taking place over the Fall and Spring semesters.
The first step in the affiliation process is to complete an interest form; the link to the form is below. Once the form is complete further instruction will be provided.

In the fall of a student’s senior year, students are required to complete 500 of Field Education.
250 hours in the fall semester; 250 in the spring semester.
No students will be allowed to graduate from the program if the Field Education hours are not completed satisfactorily.
